law.catch_line: Additional allowances for members of General Assembly.
law.text: Effective January 1, 1994, in addition to any and all sums, compensation, or expenses now paid the members of the General Assembly, each shall receive an expense allowance of one hundred ten percent (110%) of the expense allowance paid federal employees traveling in the Frankfort, Kentucky area for each calendar day. This sum shall be paid whether the General Assembly is in regular or extraordinary session and shall be in full recompense of any additional expenses incurred in excess of that now received by them.
law.history: Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 1, sec. 1, effective February 11, 1994; and ch. 486, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1994. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 437, sec. 2, effective March 31, 1978. -- Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 83, sec. 9, effective March 29, 1976. -- Amended 1960 Ky. Acts ch. 21, sec. 1. -- Created 1954Ky. Acts ch. 85, sec. 1.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/15/94). The 1994 amendment of this statute, effective February 11, 1994, was retroactive to January 1, 1994. See 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 1, sec. 2. (7/15/94). This section was amended by 1994 Ky. Acts chs. 1 and 486 which do not appear to be in conflict and have been codified together.
